etymologies: mid 16th century: from per+ cent, perhaps an abbreviation of pseudo-Latin per centum

notes.text: Both spellings, percent and per cent, are acceptable, but consistency should be maintained. Percent is more common in US usage; per cent is more common in British usage

definitions: by a specified amount in or for every hundred

examples.text: new car sales may be down nineteen percent

shortDefinitions: by specified amount in or for every hundred

notes.text: Both spellings, percent and per cent, are acceptable, but consistency should be maintained. Percent is more common in US usage; per cent is more common in British usage

examples.text: a reduction of half a percent or so in price

definitions: the rate, number, or amount in each hundred; percentage

examples.text: the percent of drug users who are infected

shortDefinitions: rate, number, or amount in each hundred
